title: A Complete Guide to Profit Margins in Stardew Valley

steps.title: Profit Margin refers to the amount of Gold you can make by selling items.
steps.content: Profit Margin refers to the amount of Gold you can make by selling items. In Stardew Valley, most of your Gold comes from growing and selling crops. By lowering the Profit Margin, you are lowering the amount you receive with each of your sales. This includes the creatures you capture via fishing in Stardew . Stardew Valley offers set Profit Margins of 100% (Normal), 75%, 50%, and 25%. If you have your Profit Margins set to 50%, an item worth 60 Gold will now be worth 30 Gold when sold. If you have your Profit Margins set to 25%, an item worth 60 Gold will now be worth 15 Gold, and so on. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Change the Profit Margin if you want a greater challenge.
steps.content: Change the Profit Margin if you want a greater challenge. If you're a veteran player or even a new player who enjoys a harder difficulty, you can adjust your Profit Margin at the beginning of a new save file. This will essentially double the amount of time needed to reach any monetary goals. While lowering the Profit Margin will also lower the expenses of seeds, other unlockable items such as the Stable and Inventory expansions will remain the same. It will take you longer to obtain these features as opposed to a normal 100% Profit Margin game. In most cases, save files with normal Profit Margins see growth in Year 2, but lower Profit Margins may take longer. You can only change your Profit Margin when you start a new save file. You'll be unable to officially change it with an existing save file. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Launch Stardew Valley.
steps.content: Launch Stardew Valley. Stardew Valley is available for Windows, Mac OS, and Linux, as well as the consoles: PlayStation 4 , PlayStation Vita, Xbox One, and Nintendo Switch. [4] X Research source For mobile users, Stardew Valley is also available for iPhone in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Click New.
steps.content: Click New . You can't change the profit margin for an existing game. You'll need to start a new save file.

steps.title: Click the wrench icon.
steps.content: Click the wrench icon. This will be near the bottom-left of the character creation window.

steps.title: Click the "Profit Margin" drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the "Profit Margin" drop-down menu. You may need to scroll to find this option. It will be underneath the checkbox for Spawn monsters on the farm .

steps.title: Select your Profit Margin.
steps.content: Select your Profit Margin. By default, it will be at 100%. Choose 75%, 50%, or 25%. The lower your Profit Margin, the less you will earn when selling items.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will save your choices.

steps.title: Complete the remaining Farm setup.
steps.content: Complete the remaining Farm setup. You'll need to create your character, fill in the required fields, and select a farm layout before you can proceed. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Your new save file will begin. You can now play Stardew Valley with your selected Profit Margin. Some aspects will remain unaffected, such as the unlocking of the sewer key .
